intro: Sisymbrium virletii, commonly known as the French rocket, is an annual flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium virletii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
